Today we continued our visits to the Silicon Valley. The first place we visited was Google.
Sergey Brin, one of Google's founders, welcomed us and took this photo with Turkish engineers from Google. http://t.co/3uxjx1t5
Sergey Brin showed me Google Glasses from Google's latest inventions. http://t.co/on6u9ygb
There was a live video on the small screen in the upper corner of the eyewear.
Sergey introduced us to Google's unmanned outbound car. http://t.co/a4fdwqkg
Sergey, Mrs. Hayrunnisa and I sat behind the car of our age. http://t.co/dwsvbvoz
When we got out of the highway, the car made a speed of 80 miles. It was wonderful. When the bus suddenly came out, the security teams had a lot of headaches.
Our second stop is Facebook. They rode the whole campus. A wonderful campus with 3,000 people working.
Sheriff Sandberg is the COO of the women's company in the solarium. http://t.co/xpvo8ı0b
We are with young Turkish engineers working on Facebook .. http://t.co/60d0ffOy
Today we finally went to Microsoft. They told us about Windows 8, so I tried it. http://t.co/7rtwrodw
Again, Microsoft's very successful young Turkish employees have taken a souvenir photo. http://t.co/pba0wsbl
It made me proud to see our graduates of the best universities in the world, all brilliant in these big technology companies.
